message.content: This question requires some basic knowledge about decomposition and the process of adding organic matter to the soil. When a dead body, like that of a mouse, breaks down in the soil, it releases nutrients and organic matter that can be absorbed by plants. Option (A) is incorrect because digging up flowers does not add organic matter to the soil. Option (B) is also incorrect because skunk scent does not contribute to the organic matter in the soil. Option (D) is incorrect because animals eating crops does not increase organic matter in the soil, as they are not adding any new organic material to it.

To answer this question, we need to have some basic knowledge about the decomposition process and how organic matter is formed in soil. When a dead body, such as that of a mouse, breaks down in the soil, it provides nutrients and organic matter that enrich the soil. Option (A) is incorrect because digging up flowers does not add organic matter to the soil. Option (B) is also incorrect because skunk spray is not organic matter and does not contribute to the increase of organic matter in soil. Option (D) is incorrect because animals eating crops planted in the soil does not directly increase the organic matter in the soil; instead, it may lead to nutrient cycling.
